title: Huston 2014 Private Reserve Petite Sirah
description: Brooding aromas of green wood, dill, smoke and purple fruit are followed by a palate that mixes equal parts fruit and barrel, with tart acidity providing the frame. There are some interesting things going on but they don't all come together.

title: Il Poggiolo 2012 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: This has subdued aromas suggesting prune and a whiff of dark spice. The tightly compacted palate shows clove, dried blackberry and tobacco leaf alongside assertive, astringent tannins that clamp down on the finish. Give the tannins several years to unclench then drink to capture the remaining fruit.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Dark Red (California)
description: Fresh and lively, this medium-bodied wine smells like white pepper and raspberries and tastes extremely fruity like blackberries and strawberries. It has a brisk mouthfeel with moderate tannins and a hint of sweetness to round off the edges.

title: Luigi Bosca 2017 A Rosé Is A Rosé Is A Rosé (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Melony aromas are basic. This Pinot Grigio-based rosé is modest on the palate, with moderate to low acidity. A core nectarine flavor turns slightly bitter on a short finish.
designation: A Rosé Is A Rosé Is A

title: Luminis 2013 Allamand H Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: A blocky, obtuse nose smells of stewed black fruits and chocolate. This wine is full and soupy in feel, but not messy. Flavors of burnt oak, pencil lead, licorice root and barbecue smoke precede a finish that narrows down and tastes reedy. It's a disjointed Cabernet.

title: Mud House 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: This is a solid if rather unexciting example of Otago Pinot, with notes of dark cherry and black current combined with savory, oaky characters of olive, cedar, vanilla and a hint of smoke. The oak is more apparent on the palate and is on the bitter side, although there's also plenty of cherry cola and dark chocolate flavors. Texturally it's a little thin, with grippy tannins and a good lick of acidity.

title: OZV 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: With a semisweet balance and loads of chocolate flavors, this wine is more of a dessert than a dinner wine. The aromas are packed with blackberry jam and raspberry syrup, while the flavors are lush and sweet and the texture soft.

title: Raineri Gianmatteo 2013 Monserra  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, baking spice and coconut. The dense palate offers espresso, prune and bitter chocolate alongside bracing tannins that grip the finish.

title: The Conqueror 2016 Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Vibrant aromas of freshly cut red apple, melon and pear are followed by a creamy, viscous palate. The texture seems a bit at odds and doesn't entirely work.

title: Uggiano 2013  Brunello di Montalcino
description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas of tilled soil, clove and dark fruit. The simple palate offers prune and vanilla alongside easygoing tannins. It has a rather fleeting finish.

title: Vini 2016 Veni Vidi Vici Chardonnay (Thracian Valley)
description: This straw colored Chardonnay has aromas of lemon pith and green apple. The palate offers flavors of honeydew melon and Granny Smith apple before leading to a smooth finish.

title: Waterbrook 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas bring pleasant notes of apples and flowers. The palate is straight down the fairway, with plump fruit flavors.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are like walking through a field of wildflowers, with off-dry fruit flavors to back it all up. There's not a lot of complexity but it still provides plenty of appeal.

title: Colter's Creek 2016 Estate Bottled Riesling (Lewis-Clark Valley (ID))
description: The aromas are a bit subdued, with notes of green apple, peach, Meyer lemon, herb and cinnamon. It drinks medium sweet, without having the acidity to fully stand it up but still providing enjoyment.

title: Cruz Alta 2013 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of campfire, rubber band and dry spices are fiery as they accompany red-berry fruit notes. A rough and pulling palate is aggressive, while peppery flavors of raspberry and red plum finish with smoke and dry herbal notes.

title: Educated Guess 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Partially fermented in barrel and partially in stainless steel, this is a likable white with plenty of ripe tropical fruit, vanilla oak and grainy texture that's made in a full-bodied robust style.

title: Fabre Montmayou 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Apple and green-fruit aromas show a touch of cheesy oak. This wine feels plump, but with citrusy acidity. Briny citrus flavors are herbal and green on the finish, with lasting tangy acidity.

title: Glazebrook 2016 041°S-174°E Regional Reserve Merlot (Hawke's Bay)
description: This is a simple yet approachable Merlot offering notes of ripe dark-berry fruit, chocolate and vanillin oak. The palate is full bodied and plush but the oak is on the clunky side, particularly on the finish.

title: Kunde 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a thick herbal effort wrapped in tart red fruit that has been blended with a small portion of Grenache. The flavors lean into strawberry and raspberry, with rich oak and baking spices adding to the full-bodied picture.

title: Laurent Miquel 2015 Solas Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Herbal, foresty tones set the stage for red cherry, strawberry and rhubarb aromas on the nose of this earthy wine. Fresh and light on its feet, it offers soft tannins to frame the ripe red-fruit flavors. Clean, juicy and approachable, enjoy this now.

title: Les Jamelles 2016 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Red currant and cherry fruit lead the bouquet of this fresh and inviting wine, with pleasant hints of fresh mint and tree bark for subtle depth. The palate is light but fruit-forward, with soft tannins and ample acidity that result in a harmonious package. Drink now.

title: Los Clop 2015 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Ripe berry and raisin aromas include a heavy coating of cedary oak. This wine is massive, tannic and bloated on the palate, with little to no elegance. Cassis, blackberry, coconut and vanilla flavors finish saturated and intense, with extracted tannins.

title: Maryhill 2016 Proprietor's Reserve Tudor Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Bright, fruity aromas of fresh cantaloupe, apple, biscuit and pear lead to a light palate of creamy canned corn and citrus flavors. It finishes tart and a little bitter.

title: Monteviejo 2016 Festivo Torrontés (La Rioja)
description: Aromas of vanilla, pastry, lychee and pear are true to the variety. An oily-feeling palate is cut and balanced by citric acidity. Salty flavors of citrus fruits and green melon culminate on a texturally exact finish

title: PRIE Vineyards and Winery 2014 Hux Vineyard Petit Verdot (Lodi)
description: This relatively light-bodied and pleasant wine has mild fruit and spice aromas followed by gentle cherry and clove flavors that drop off quickly on the finish. It tastes soft and easy.

title: Santa Julia 2017 [+] Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Friendly, powdery aromas of tropical fruits are more simple than serious. This Torrontés feels oily and round, with citric acidity. Flavors of orange peel, grapefruit and lychee are more citrusy than tropical on the finish.

title: Tommasi 2016 Poggio al Tufo Vermentino (Toscana)
description: Citrus blossom and yellow stone-fruit aromas lead the way on this bright white. On the straightforward palate, tangy acidity brightens juicy peach and nectarine.

title: Van Ruiten 2016 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)
description: This light-bodied wine has a lively, slightly spritzy texture and lots of vivid canteloupe and peach flavors accented by earth and white pepper. It's definitely better than your average neutral-tasting Pinot Grigio.

title: Vignerons Ardéchois 2016 Fonvène Rosé (Ardèche)
description: Slightly restrained peach and raspberry mingle amid pronounced layers of earth and dusty mineral in this dry rosé. While rustic in style, vibrant acidity and balanced alcohol lend refreshment.

title: Vignerons Ardéchois 2016 Gris d'Ardeche Rosé (Ardèche)
description: Initial whiffs of smoke and earth blow off to reveal pretty but subdued raspberry and cherry aromas. It's delicate in concentration but a revitalizing sip, with fresh acidity and balanced alcohol.
